text:
You create the api request on an external server e.g. php then you can post to that server which uses the api key to post back to HubSpot.
The reason being if you used the api key in javascript on you’re site anyone can see the key in your code and with that key, has access to all the api’s including adding/deleting pages, getting/deleting contact data etc…
<@UG52C29EE> any thoughts on this? It would great to have a header tags as well a view source button added to the rich text field in HubDB.
Hey Chris, I will work with my team here and let u know what we can do to help you.

Hey, all. I'm working with HubDB in a custom module. Is it possible to use a variable as a filterQuery inside a HubDB for loop? for example:
```{% set productCount = module.product_count %}
  {% for row in hubdb_table_rows(1039442, '&limit=productCount') %}```
I want the user to be able to define the number of rows returned in the table.
<@UB690RZA7> you can make that whole filterquery a variable you feed in
just add the string to your productcount var and swap the variable in for the whole filter query
